item.name: Age of Mythology: The Boardgame
item.comment: The Norse always seem to win.

item.name: Age of Renaissance
item.comment: If you fall behind in the early turns, you can sit back and watch 5 hours of life fade away (little to no hope of catching up).

item.name: Aliens
item.comment: I've been playing this game solo and with friends for years. The Reactor Room scenario is excellent!

item.name: The American Civil War
item.comment: I enjoy the historical, unbalanced game play. I play as the south vs my wife, and the handicap balances out my strategy game experience.

item.name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: Reinforcements Pack #1
Backgammon
item.comment: Easy to teach and play with non-gamers.

item.name: Balloon Cup
item.comment: My wife's initial impression is that she likes Lost Cities better because there's less cutthroat gameplay. I seem to like it equally compared to Lost Cities.

item.name: Battleball
item.comment: I don't like football, but this game's really fun. I enjoy how quickly it plays.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: I've played this over 10 times. There are some clear differences from Memoir. The core game isn't any more complicated for medieval adventures (without lore and war council). With lore and the war council the game really shines, with more choices and endless replayability for scenarios. The rulebook is excellent, with great examples. Bring on the expansions!

item.name: BattleLore: Call to Arms
item.comment: Call to Arms is a great option on top of BattleLore, but I wouldn't always want to play using it. The game prep time is significantly increased. The extra time will be even longer as more cards are available for players to choose from. I feel the same way about epic battlelore, and with the two combined it'll be a really intricate and long game. I hope that Days of Wonder continues to publish interesting preset battles for quicker games.

item.name: BattleLore: Epic BattleLore
item.comment: Based on 1 play. Bigger battlefield, more figures, and more command cards make for a cool game, but the increased setup and play time push this into the category of games that I won't be able to play as often. I think this will be an enjoyable option once in awhile, but it won't replace regular Battlelore.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: Another fun game that I can get almost any non-gamer to try.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Princess & the Dragon
item.comment: My issue with this expansion is the effect on game length. There are around 30 new tiles added. The game gets dragged out a lot to get through that many more tiles. Our game took around 3 hrs, which is too long for me in a eurogame.

item.name: Catan: Cities & Knights â€“ 5-6 Player Extension
Checkers
item.comment: The one game I can play against my father-in-law.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: Tough to find someone of equal skill to play. Not fun at all if playing someone of a different skill level.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.comment: I like that the game plays quickly, is fun to play, and easy to explain. The neatest aspect of this game is feeding the most corrupt player to the crocodiles. That forces tough choices throughout the game.

item.name: Descent: The Altar of Despair
item.comment: I still love Descent, but after playing a few expansion scenarios it's clear that FFG made an already long game even longer. Options are great, but it's gone overboard. The overlord card substitions can take a really long time. There are more monster spawn cards than ever, and we had monsters being spawned almost every turn. Our first Altar of Despair session took around 7 hours to play!

item.name: Descent: The Well of Darkness
item.comment: Adds some of everything to Descent. Can't get enough of a good thing. The quests are different and interesting.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Great game for anyone who likes dungeon crawls. Extremely difficult for the marines. Not as much character variety as Descent.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame Expansion Set
item.comment: The first play of the first expansion scenario, "A Snowball's Chance", was very close. The invader won one turn before the 2 marines escaped through the exit.

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: What I like most about this game: WWII theme; a 2P wargame that my wife is willing to play; high-quality components; not clear who's going to win until the end

item.name: Dueltrack: A Car Wars Deluxe Supplement
Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
E.T.I.: Estimated Time to Invasion
item.comment:
Great theme - reminds me of X-com. The players have to work together to survive the invasion, scheme to be the survivor with the most fame, and worry about which player is really an alien. It's really neat that you can scale the difficulty of the game (by changing the alien powers) and the scale the length of the game (by changing the number of projects to be researched). Nearly every turn starts with an event that usually generates fun player interactions.
I played this game twice: at GenCon and at GASPcon. I'm looking forward to getting a copy in January.

item.name: The End of the Triumvirate
item.comment: This game is really great for 3 players.

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Final Days: Miniatures Battle Game
item.comment: The card mechanics are terrible. Not intuitive at all. I would like the minis better if they weren't cartoonish.

item.name: Gemlok
item.comment: My first 2P game went well, but the second dragged out as neither of us got many gemlok rolls and neither had enough of a lead to call the end of game. I think the game will be a lot more fun with 4 players and a fixed end game condition of ~15 turns.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment: It needs a scoring system.

item.name: Groo: The Game
item.comment: Great game for 4 players, less enjoyable with more or less players.

item.name: Groo: The Game â€“ Expansion Set
Heroscape Expansion Set: Malliddon's Prophecy
item.comment: The expansion figures add a lot to the game. Now you can have theme armies with lots of "common squads" (more than 1 unit allowed in your army).

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro
Hordes
item.comment: Based on two starter battles.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: This got old really fast, and I found little humor in the cards.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment: Based on 5 plays. This game's a lot of fun. The B-movie photo art on all the cards really captures the zombie horror theme. The rules are simple and the game plays quickly. The card events and items add lots of tension and chaos. The game has a high luck factor (dice & cards). It seems hard for the heroes to win, but maybe we're just using bad tactics.

item.name: Lock 'n Load: Band of Heroes
item.comment: The rules are somewhat confusing. Sometimes roll high, sometimes low. Very difficult to pick up and play for the first time.

item.name: Lord of the Fries
item.comment: After a second play it feels like this game drags on way too long with 6 people. House rules could shorten it some.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: Combat Hex Tradeable Miniatures Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Memoir '44: Air Pack
item.comment: See my Pointe-du-Hoc session report for first impressions.

item.name: Monsterpocalypse
item.comment: I've been burned on collectible games in the past, but the theme and game design have me hooked. The dice pool system is really nice. I like being able to control the odds by deciding how many dice to use in an attack. The special abilities of monsters, units, and buildings add lots of fun and fit the theme. The martians abduct enemies into the mothership, the Cthul sacrifice their own units for health, etc.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Al Capone and the Chicago Underworld
Mystery Rummy: Murders in the Rue Morgue
Pirateology: The Game
item.comment: The rules are horribly broken. There's nothing to stop each player from quickly burying one gold coin on various islands. Once treasure is buried a player can't be eliminated from the game (the only way for the game to end). There are very few treasure map cards in the deck that can be used to steal another player's buried treasure. The result is a game that never ends.

item.name: Pizarro & Co.
item.comment: The various game mechanics do not seem to match the theme at all. Not to mention that you're bidding on explorers from different time periods - at the same time. That being said, my rating is based on a themeless auction game.

item.name: Puerto Rico: Expansion I â€“ New Buildings
Risk: The Lord of the Rings
item.comment: Gave this away to a friend after getting the trilogy edition (which is much better IMHO).

item.name: Risk: The Lord of the Rings Trilogy Edition
Saint Petersburg
item.comment: Not very good with 2 players.

item.name: Screaming Eagles
item.comment: I enjoyed this game as a kid because it was quick, had actual miniature planes, and non-gamers could play easily.

item.name: Sequence
item.comment: The non-gamers in my family enjoy this.

item.name: Snakes and Ladders
item.comment: I would only play this game if I couldn't talk my nieces into playing anything else.

item.name: Sorry!
item.comment: Good game to play with my two young nieces.

item.name: Tempus
item.comment: Wow, I've never had my opinion of a game drop so quickly. I had initially rated this game a 9. The tiles slide around on the board and the people tokens are hard to stack. The rule preventing anyone from attacking a player with 3 or less stacks, regardless of how many cities they have, is ridiculous. The player can still attack others. The winning strategy is apparently to take advantage of this rule. Other rules are bearable but just weird. Only expand population in the plains? No new population from cities? No cities in mountains?

item.name: Thebes
item.comment: A eurogame with tons of theme. I don't think that there's too much luck.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment: The full-size cards are nicer to handle than the mini ones. The mega variant is a nice way to up the tension by giving each player more tickets initially and when taking tickets as an action. That and the "most tickets completed" bonus push players to create a rail network that covers more tickets than they're used to.

item.name: Tide of Iron
item.comment: Ever since playing Axis & Allies in the 80s I've always wanted a squad-level WWII game. Advanced Squad Leader always seemed overly complicated and dull with just cardboard chits. This game really hits the sweet spot between tactical complexity and ease of play. I can't wait to play it again.

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment: This game plays fast, plays well with 2, my wife and I both enjoy it, and our games have been close.

item.name: A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game
Travel Sequence
item.comment: There's a bit of strategy in using your 1 & 2-eyed jacks against your opponent, and choosing which of your cards to play next. It's a quick, light game to play while traveling, and small enough to bring along. Regular sequence is a better choice if you have the space to bring it.

item.name: Trump: The Game
item.comment: I am rating the new version of the game. The addition of 16 "You're Fired!" cards totally ruins bidding for the 7 properties. It got to the point of everyone bidding minimum and firing each other every time!

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shattered Empire
item.comment: The new set of strategy cards really improve on the original set. They all feel useful, and the Imperial 2VP is gone. The 4th ring around Mecatol Rex makes for a longer game and bigger space fleets. I'd probably play without it next time. The race-specific techs and other new techs are great. I can't wait to play this again!

item.name: U.S. Patent No. 1
item.comment: I really like the theme, but the rules seem broken. We tried to think of rules tweaks, but it seems a total rules re-write would be needed.

item.name: Uncle Wiggily
item.comment: As a young child I enjoyed this game. I would play it now for nostalgia.

item.name: War! Age of Imperialism
item.comment: The initial exploration is too luck-based, causing imbalance in player expansion.

item.name: Warhammer Quest: Catacombs of Terror
item.comment: Not easy to add this into your WQ games w/o a lot of other figures not in the box.

item.name: Warhammer Quest: Lair of the Orc Lord
item.comment: Not easy to add this into your WQ games w/o a lot of other figures not in the box.
